author: N Robinson
comment: I would like to be able to track basic cardio and health statistics. Things like calories burned  and weight. For calories burned, I just want to enter what my treadmill or exercise machine calculates. In other words, I don't need the app to calculate it, I just want to be able to enter it as a statistic for my cardiac routine.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Our aim was partly to improve performance and mainly UI so this sounds surprising. What screens are slower?  We released a new version today, try if that one's better.

author: Stefano Prandi
comment: I like this app for Android wear, but I'd like to see icon or draw symbols of the exercise. Thanks a lot

author: Henrik Selin
comment: Beefcake!

author: Arash Outadi
comment: Super simple and awesome

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Great to hear you enjoy Beefcake! Any suggestions on improvements?

author: Rafael Vera Jr
comment: Great easy to use app that doesn't confuse you on every move you make. Thanks a million.
title: Finally..

author: Julian Thompson
comment: Used to be the best workout app on android, but I've since switched to the app 'Progression' which syncs with Google fit and allows you to set a different rest time for each exercise in your routine. This app has become more complicated without adding useful features.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: We asked in August 2016 (4 months ago) if you countdown time per exercise or per category but never got a reply? In what way has the app become more complicated - we removed lots of things in the big Sept 2016 release to make it simpler.

title: Great app

author: Thomas Jackson
comment: No more notebooks or programs that claim they do what I need, Beefcake has it all this is the BEST on the market! I love being able to create my own workouts and download the information so my doctor and I can track my progress, Thank you for building an app the works.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: That's awesome to hear Thomas! We're really happy this not only improves your workouts but also helps your doctor improve your well being. Keep training and have fun doing it!

title: Best Log Out There

author: Liam Hughes
comment: Hands down the best workout tracker on Android, with an incredibly intuitive design that allows me to spend more time lifting and less time fiddling. The only bad thing? It seems to be reasonably unknown, never listed in roundups of Android workout apps. Maybe it needs more advertising?

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Thanks Liam! You are probably right regarding marketing. We really need to shape up in that area, will start off by doing some FB campaigns! And also to reply reviewers faster. :)

title: Nothing Compares

author: John Barnabas Hughes
comment: 800 times better than me tweaking a note file, and with no bells and whistles to work around. This made what I already do quicker. As simple as that. And also logs workouts to days on a calendar, which I would never bother to do myself. I rarely review, but it's a crime that this isn't a better known app over some ridiculous workout loggers with animations and oodles of complications.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Glad you like the simplicity! We will release a major update in September. You can already try it out if you sign up for the beta testing program. Email us if you're interested!

title: Excellent

author: Donna Bauer
comment: I just downloaded this app and I'm already loving what I'm seeing. I don't know if it could be possible, but is there any way the mpoints can be incorporated,  maybe a widget ? Just wondering, this app is already great though. Keep up the great work.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Sounds like a nifty feature Donna! Could you make a simple drawing of what you expect and email us? Cheers and thanks a bunch for your feedback! :)

title: Very happy.

author: Robert Krook
comment: Not enough exercises to choose from. They're badly categorized (deadlifts does not show up as a back exercise).
title: Bad data

author: Marcel Uithoof
comment: ...and absolutely one of the best of its kind...but no option to buy. Only a subscription (for what?) 👎 Therefor I decided to choose for GymRun which has a fixed price.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Like it says in description under Pro Features (statistics and database import). If you don't need those you can use it for free, like most ppl do. We could add a buy once option but it would be priced like 3 years subscription, would that be useful?

title: Great program...

author: Salman Abedin
comment: I've used almost all the tracking apps around here & I must say this is the first one I'm impressed with.Kudos Patrick & Magnus.
title: First of It's Kind

author: Infant Jerin
comment: Good App. It would be better if you add more workout and categorized workout

author: Jens Bråkenhielm
comment: Hands down the best there is. Great work, and keep updating and listen to the users, the way you do! Awesome!
title: The best

author: Santa Dehoyos
comment: How do I delete a log?

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Open it, summary tab, option menu, delete

title: Just Started

author: Holly S.
comment: Great app!

author: Matthew Bouwman
comment: Very effective workout logging app which continues to improve with regular updates.
title: Simple, customisable, powerful

author: Shayne Matheson
comment: Has everything you need to yrack workouts
title: Great workout app

author: ianbradbury0374
comment: Really good App that does the simple things well....easy to programme.
title: Simplicity-Almost Perfect

author: Master T
comment: Good approach but the app is not polished yet. I have no problem with the payment system as people need to get paid for their work but the current rate might be a bit expensive for the offered "pro" features. This app is similar to FitNotes except FitNotes is a lot better, more polished, offers more features, and free
title: Not very polished product

author: alexis herrera
comment: The UI in this app makes no sense. I spend more time fiddling around with the app trying to track my workout than actually working out. There are days where I avoid using it at all.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: And for that you give it 1 star? Have you checked the tutorial? If you are specific we might be able to improve.

title: Text book example of what not to do.

author: Jim Rorie
comment: USABILITY! The killer part of Beefcake that the other programs don’t get is usability.  Usability is ultra-important when you are lifting. Because if you are doing it right, you are zonked.  You don’t have the time or energy to fiddle with an app.  No complicated drop-down boxes or repetitive entry.  Weights are properly auto-populated. The timer doesn't block the screen. (Jefit I’m looking at you)  In Beefcake, it tracks were you were and were you are.  One or two single presses to enter data.  That’s it.  Three options to track repetitions should satisfy straight liners and pyramid types.   Yes, there are things missing like cloud storage and Google fit integration. But I hear an Android Wear version is in beta, so development is ongoing.  And I haven’t had a crash yet. The basics are there and they are solid. Some of the importing and graphs are paid.  But’s like 1/3 of a Starbuck Verde per month.  Come on, throw the dudes a buck.
title: Why this is the greatest Weight Training tracker in the history of mankind.

author: Douglas Halladay
comment: Solid

author: Surf Tomas
comment: The Best

author: Richard Chow
comment: Hey guys, you've made a beautiful app. I paid instantly when I realized there were metrics. Some little changes I'd like to see, when scroll on the stats->exercise tab to view the grab, I can only swipe the graph left and right, not the numbers. Also, when viewing volume for the day, it'd be nice to see it for specific exercises so I can calculate if I did less or more volume. Besides that, the app is amazing!

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Great suggestions, we'd appreciate if you could write the same in our Google plus community since the reply feature here is bad.

title: Love the app! Would like some minor changes.

author: Milagros Santiago
comment: I use it for myvworkout at home
title: Great app

author: Enrico Richiello
comment: Got everything you need. I've been using it since the first versions!
title: Great App

author: Otto Blomqvist
comment: The best one I've found so far

author: Steve Carrillo
comment: great for workout progress.
title: love it!

author: Edd Stance
comment: The pro features are reasonable but I'm not willing to pay monthly! One of fee would be much better but I feel like I'm going back to redy gym log, this is due to lack of free export/backup feature! And moving between phones is difficult... Other that that it is great!

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content:
Export/backup is free. You mean import (which is part of Pro)? You can however use trial twice for free if switching to a new phone.

You can save 3 months by taking a yearly subscription. To be sure you won't be charged after a year because you forgotten about it you can cancel it the day after you subscribe (it will still last for a year).

title: Meh

author: Robert Buck
comment: Could use the ability to put points in distance such as 1.34 mile and a body highlight muscular map to show muscle  grouping by workout also a schedual for reminders on dates and notifications and use of the s5 heart  rate tracker  and pedometer would be nice and as before a timer pause forsome things would be nice too.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: We will add points in distance. Muscular map is an interesting suggestion, we'll look into it. Planning is released in beta today. Notifications reminding you we should add. Supporting s5 stuff is a bit difficult as we don't have one. Timer can be paused by touching it.

title: Pro features  are worth it for tracking

author: James Flello
comment: Absolutely brilliant! A truly phenomenal app,  it was exactly what I was looking for! Going to purchase pro features once I've been using it more. Helps to organise and track your routine really easily.
title: Amazing

author: Vlad Gydz
comment: So-so..

author: Mike Burgo
comment: I have tried many different training log apps, and Beefcake is by far the best.  I especially like the clean UI, and the ability to add custom exercises and make a workout on the fly, or to create a routine and save it.  The only thing this app is missing is the ability to enter in notes for each exercise.  It would be nice to be able to note if you failed on a rep, or if a weight felt heavier than usual.  If a notes section could be added, this app would be perfect.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Would a comment option for an exercise similar to the one for a workout log be sufficient?

title: Great training log

author: John Galt
comment: Upgrading to 4* in hopes latest upgrade fixes crashing.                  Was liking this app to replace iTunes Gym Buddy but now crashes half way through workouts. It's a no go for me. The search goes on for a simple straightforward workout log.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: Hi John, please let us know what you did when it crashed and we will fix it quickly. It's also helpful for us if you press the "Report" button that comes up in a dialogue after a crash.

title: Keeps Crashing

author: David Hewitt
comment: Only gripe is that some of the machines in my gym are in lbs and some in kg. Always the weight defaults to kg, e.g. if I did 3x80lbs last time, the log sets 3x80kgs the next time. Small difference, please fix!

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content: As of now the weight unit is not stored on the exercise level but only on the app level but we could of course look for what the previous weight unit used was and use that.

title: Really Useful

author: Slawek Zalewski
comment: I have been on the hunt for an app that would be able to track my circuit workouts and provide me with all the right information and stats. I must have tried and looked at 20 different apps at least. Some of them were quite close to what I wanted for my circuit training but it was only once I have looked, tested and tried Beefcake that I can finally say I have found what I need. I am fairly sure there is plenty of things that can be done with the app to make it even better but for anyone doing any kind of circuit training, there is no better app than this one.
title: The best app for tracking your circuit workouts

author: Kimberley CARTLIDGE
comment: Honestly this is a great app but my only criticisms are that there are decimal point options for weight there aren't any for distance. :( Also a speed input for treadmill and input for interval training would be incredibly helpful.

reply.author: PAMB
reply.content:
Our idea was to keep it simple and skip dec points for distance and instead let people do input in m/ft, but seems some people don't like it.
Speed could be calculated using distance and time. Would it be enough showing that somewhere? Or is there some other reason to input speed manually?
What kind of interval training input are you suggesting?

title: Decimal points!!!

author: Kat Bodine
comment: Exactly what I needed to track my gym workout.This app is clean, well organized, and easy to use.
title: Perfect
